meanings.definition: To cause to arch in the middle.
meanings.sent1: The heavy weight hogged the wooden plank.
meanings.sent2: She hogged the rope, making it bend in the middle.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat hogged the toy, bending it in the middle.
meanings.sent4: The old bridge hogged under the pressure of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The bookshelf hogged under the weight of the books.

meanings.definition: To take more than one's share of.
meanings.sent1: He always hogged the cookies during snack time.
meanings.sent2: The greedy child hogged all the candies at the party.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hogged all the nuts, leaving none for the others.
meanings.sent4: She hogged the spotlight during the entire performance.
meanings.sent5: The bully hogged the swing, not letting anyone else have a turn.
